member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText
member.summary: Specifies the class which contains barcode display text data and functionalities.

example.code: <SfBarcodeGenerator Width="200" Height="200" Value="65213323" Type="BarcodeType.Code11" BackgroundColor="white" ForeColor="black" EnableCheckSum="true" > <BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText Text = "" Font="monospace" Size="25" Alignment="Alignment.Right" Position="TextPosition.Top" Visibility="true"> <BarcodeTextMargin Left = "0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="0"></BarcodeTextMargin> </BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText> </SfBarcodeGenerator>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets content for Barcode generator display text element including HTML support and its customizations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Alignment
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text. By default, it is set to Center.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Font
member.summary: Defines the font style of the text. By default, it is set to monospace.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Margin
member.summary: It sets the space to be left between the text and its barcode. By default, it is set to 10 from all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Position
member.summary: Defines the position of the text. By default, it is set to Bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Size
member.summary: Defines the size of the text. By default, it is set to 20.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Text
member.summary: Sets the textual description of the barcode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText.Visibility
member.summary: Defines the visibility of the text. By default, it is set to true.

member.summary: OnInitializedAsync is invoked when the component is initialized.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.SfBarcodeGenerator
member.summary: Represents the class, which contains data and functionalities for SfBarcode.

example.code:
<SfBarcodeGenerator Width="200" Height="200" Value="65213323" Type="BarcodeType.Code11" BackgroundColor="white" ForeColor="black" EnableCheckSum="true" OnValidationFailed="@OnInvalid">
             <BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText Text = "" Font="monospace" Size="25" Alignment="Alignment.Left" Position="TextPosition.Top">
               <BarcodeTextMargin Left = "10" Top="10" Right="10" Bottom="10"></BarcodeTextMargin>
             </BarcodeGeneratorDisplayText>
             <BarcodeMargin Left = "10" Top="10" Right="10" Bottom="10"></BarcodeMargin>
            </SfBarcodeGenerator>
            @code{
             public void OnInvalid(ValidationFailedEventArgs args)
             {
             }
            }

member.summary: Specifies the line and text color of the barcode. By default, it is set to black.

member.summary: Specifies the height of the barcode model. By default, it is set to 100%.

member.summary: Specifies the margin properties for the barcode. By default, it is set to 10 from all sides.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeExportType
member.summary: Represents the export type of barcode. By default, it is set to JPG.

example.code:
<input type = "button" value="Export" @onclick="@OnExport" />
            <SfQRCodeGenerator Width = "200px" Height="150px" Value="Syncfusion" >
               <QRCodeGeneratorDisplayText text = "Text" ></ QRCodeGeneratorDisplayText >
            </ SfQRCodeGenerator >
              @code{
              private void OnExport()
              {
              QRcode.Export("fileName", BarcodeExportType.JPG);
              }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.SfDataMatrixGenerator
member.summary: Represents the data and functionalities for SfDataMatrixGenerator.

example.code:
<SfDataMatrixGenerator Width="200" Height="200" Value="65213323" Encoding="DataMatrixEncoding.ASCIINumeric" BackgroundColor="white" ForeColor="black" OnValidationFailed="@OnInvalid">
             <DataMatrixGeneratorDisplayText Text = "" Font="monospace" Size="25" Alignment="Alignment.Left" Position="TextPosition.Top">
                 <DataMatrixTextMargin Left = "0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="0"></DataMatrixTextMargin>
             </DataMatrixGeneratorDisplayText>
             <DataMatrixMargin Left = "10" Top="10" Right="10" Bottom="10"></ DataMatrixMargin >
            </SfDataMatrixGenerator>
            @code{
              public void OnInvalid(ValidationFailedEventArgs args)
              {
              }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Represents the recovery capacity of the QRcode.

� Low
� Medium
� Quartile
� High

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BarcodeGenerator.SfQRCodeGenerator
member.summary: Specifies all the properties for the QRCode to be rendered.

example.code:
<SfQRCodeGenerator Width="200" Height="200" Version="QRCodeVersion.Version40" Value="65213323"  BackgroundColor="white" ForeColor="black" OnValidationFailed="@OnInvalid">
             <QRCodeGeneratorDisplayText Text = "" Font="monospace" Size="25" Alignment="Alignment.Left" Position="TextPosition.Top">
                <QRCodeTextMargin Left = "0" Top="0" Right="0" Bottom="0"></QRCodeTextMargin>
             </QRCodeGeneratorDisplayText>
             <QRMargin Left = "10" Top="10" Right="10" Bottom="10"></QRMargin>
            </SfQRCodeGenerator>
            @code{
             public void OnInvalid(ValidationFailedEventArgs args)
             {
             }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions
member.summary: A class that provides options to configure global settings for our Syncfusion Blazor components.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.IgnoreScriptIsolation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Syncfusion Blazor scripts are loaded internally using JavaScript Isolation or refer to the required scripts from the application-end for better performance.
member.value: false, if the Blazor scripts are loaded from built-in source using JavaScript Isolation internally. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the property value is true, the scripts should be referenced externally in the application-end from NuGet or CDN or by generating from CRG.
member.example:
You can add script reference in one of the following ways externally for better performance when IgnoreScriptIsolation is true.
Reference scripts from NuGet To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.PdfViewer/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="_content/Syncfusion.Blazor.WordProcessor/scripts/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Reference scripts from CDN To add script reference for all component except PdfViewer and DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for PdfViewer.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-pdfviewer.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
To add script reference for DocumentEditor.
<script src="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/blazor/19.3.43/syncfusion-blazor-documenteditor.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
Note: Ensure to change the version in CDN link based on the syncfusion version you are using.
Reference scripts by generating from Blazor CRG for only used components Generate a required component script and styles from Blazor custom resource generator(Blazor CRG) and refer to them in your application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRippleEffect
member.summary: Specifies whether the ripple effect is enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the ripple effect is enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.GlobalOptions.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies whether the Rtl mode enabled in the application.
member.value: true, if the Rtl mode enabled in the application. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon based on the text content in the button and its default value is Left. The possible values are: - Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. - Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content. - Top: The icon will be positioned to the top of the text content. - Bottom: The icon will be positioned to the bottom of the text content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Checked
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the CheckBox is `checked` or not. When set to `true`, the CheckBox will be in `checked` state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.CssClass
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space in the CheckBox element. You can add custom styles to the CheckBox by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the CheckBox is `disabled` or not. When set to `true`, the CheckBox will be in `disabled` state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Indeterminate
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the CheckBox is in `indeterminate` state or not. When set to `true`, the CheckBox will be in `indeterminate` state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Label
member.summary: Defines the caption for the CheckBox, that describes the purpose of the CheckBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.LabelPosition
member.summary: Positions label `before`/`after` the CheckBox. The possible values are: Before - The label is positioned to left of the CheckBox. After - The label is positioned to right of the CheckBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Name
member.summary: Defines `name` attribute for the CheckBox. It is used to reference form data (CheckBox value) after a form is submitted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.CheckBoxModel`1.Value
member.summary: Defines `value` attribute for the CheckBox. It is a form data passed to the server when submitting the form.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1
member.summary: A base class for form input components.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the caption for the input, that describes the purpose of the input including HTML and its customization.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.CssClass
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space in the component wrapper element. You can add custom styles to the component by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.Name
member.summary: Defines name attribute for the input element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.Value
member.summary: Defines value attribute for the input element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.Checked
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is checked or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is disabled or not. When set to true, the component will be in disabled state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as title , native events etc., to the element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfInputBase`1.Created
member.summary: Triggers once the component rendering is completed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconSize
member.summary: Defines the icons to render with predefined size. IconSize will be included only when the icons will render using property.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconSize.Small
member.summary: Denotes the smaller size of icon. The icon size will be `8px`.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconSize.Medium
member.summary: Denotes the default size of icon. The icon size will be `16px`.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconSize.Large
member.summary: Denotes the larger size of icon. The icon size will be `24px`.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon
member.summary: SfIcon component used to render the predefined syncfusion icons using property or custom font icons using property.
member.example:
The below example shows loading syncfusion icon using property.
<SfIcon Name="IconName.Italic" Title="Italic"></SfIcon>
The below example shows loading syncfusion icon using property.
<SfIcon IconCss="e-icons e-bold" Title="Bold"></SfIcon>
The below example shows loading third party icon using component. Plus icon were loaded from open iconic, by defining the open iconic font CSS.
<SfIcon IconCss="oi oi-plus" Title="Plus"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for Icon component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to icon element.
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string which can be used to provide custom icon or custom style for icons.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to provide custom icon or custom style for icons. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: IconCss property used to append custom class to the predefined icons. This property will also render the customized icons like font-awesome icons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the built-in syncfusion icons to render.
member.remarks: This property is used to render icons from predefined options. You can use to load custom icons.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Bold"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the icon.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the size of the icon. The default value is
member.remarks: The Size property used to set font size for icons. This property will considered only when icons are rendered using property.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Paste" Size="IconSize.Large"></SfIcon>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets title attribute for icon.
member.value: Accepts a string. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Title attribute used to improve accessibility with screen readers and show a tooltip on mouse over the icon.

example.code: <SfIcon Name="IconName.Cut" Title="Cut"></SfIcon>

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfIcon.SetParametersAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ParameterView)
member.summary: Triggers while properties get dynamically changed in the component.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton`1
member.summary: The RadioButton is a graphical user interface element that allows you to select one option from the choices. It contains checked and unchecked states.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton`1.Label
member.summary: Defines the caption for the RadioButton, that describes the purpose of the RadioButton.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton`1.LabelPosition
member.summary: Positions label `before`/`after` the RadioButton. The possible values are: - Before: The label is positioned to left of the RadioButton. - After: The label is positioned to right of the RadioButton.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton`1.ValueChange
member.summary: Event trigger when the RadioButton state has been changed by user interaction.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSwitch`1
member.summary: The Switch is a graphical user interface element that allows you to toggle between checked and unchecked states.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSwitch`1.OnLabel
member.summary: Specifies a text that indicates the Switch is in checked state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSwitch`1.OffLabel
member.summary: Specifies a text that indicates the Switch is in unchecked state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSwitch`1.ValueChange
member.summary: Triggers when Switch state has been changed by user interaction.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1
member.summary: The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.CalendarEditContext
member.summary: Specifies the editcontext of the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Max
member.summary: Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Min
member.summary: Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.CalendarMode
member.summary: Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.KeyConfigs

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DatePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

By default, StrictMode is in false. It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker`1.Format
member.summary:
Gets or sets the required date format to the start and end date string.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker`1.InputAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element. If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum span of days that can be allowed in date range selection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DateRangePicker. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Specifies the DateRangePicker to act as strict. So that, it allows to enter only a valid date value within a specified range or else it will resets to previous value.
By default, StrictMode is in false. It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class.

member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via typing. When set as false, the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via picker only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DateRangePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary:
Enable or disable the persisting DateRangePicker's state between the page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted.
StartDate
EndDate
Value
.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateRangePicker in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.
.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in DateRangePicker.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'"..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateRangePicker considers the property value..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.KeyConfigs
member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DateRangePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date that can be selected in the calendar-popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.MaxDays
member.summary: Specifies the maximum span of days that can be allowed in a date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the calendar-popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.MinDays
member.summary: Specifies the minimum span of days that can be allowed in date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DateRangePicker. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Presets
member.summary: Set the predefined ranges which let the user pick required range easily in a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Separator
member.summary: Sets or gets the string that used between the start and end date string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon in DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether StrictMode Specifies the DateRangePicker to act as strict. So that, it allows to enter only a valid date value within a specified range or else it will resets to previous value.
By default, StrictMode is in false. It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.WeekNumber
member.summary: Determines whether the week number of the Calendar is to be displayed or not. The week number is displayed in every week row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the DateRangePicker component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.ZIndex

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is Short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.
.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting DateTimePicker's state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateTimePicker in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateTimePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateTimePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateTimePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateTimePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateTimePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateTimePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.
.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in DateTimePicker.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'"..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateTimePicker considers the property value..

member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DateTimePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the DateTimePicker.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the DateTimePicker.

member.summary: By default, the date value will be processed based on system time zone. If you want to process the initial date value using server time zone then specify the time zone value to `ServerTimezoneOffset` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Specifies the DateTimePicker to act as strict. So that, it allows to enter only a valid date value within a specified range or else it will resets to previous value.
By default, StrictMode is in false. It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart
member.summary: Accumulation chart is a Data visualization component which is divided into slices to represent the given numerical values. In this each slice represents its corresponding numerical value.
The accumulation chart control is used to visualize the data in the different types of graphical representations with built-in features like Grouping, legends, tooltip, and more.

member.summary: The background color of the chart, which accepts data in hex, rgba as a valid CSS color string.

member.summary: The background image of the chart that accepts data in string as url link or location of an image.

member.summary: Specifies the dataSource for the AccumulationChart. It can be an array of JSON objects or an instance of DataManager.

member.summary: Specifies Query to select data from dataSource. This property is applicable only when the dataSource is `Ej.DataManager`.

member.summary: Triggers when dataSource for the chart changed.

member.summary: If set true, enables the animation for accumulation chart.

member.summary: If set true, enables the border in pie chart while mouse moving.

member.summary: If set true, labels for the point will be placed smartly without overlapping.

member.summary: The height of the chart as a string in order to provide input as both like '100px' or '100%'. If specified as '100%, chart will render to the full height of its parent element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart.HighlightMode
member.summary: Specifies whether point has to get highlighted or not. Takes chartItems either 'None 'or 'Point'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart.HighlightPattern
member.summary: Specifies whether series or data point has to be selected. They are, none: sets none as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. chessboard: sets chess board as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. dots: sets dots as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. diagonalForward: sets diagonal forward as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. crosshatch: sets crosshatch as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. pacman: sets pacman highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. diagonalbackward: sets diagonal backward as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. grid: sets grid as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. turquoise: sets turquoise as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. star: sets star as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. triangle: sets triangle as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. circle: sets circle as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. tile: sets tile as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. horizontaldash: sets horizontal dash as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. verticaldash: sets vertical dash as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. rectangle: sets rectangle as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. box: sets box as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. verticalstripe: sets vertical stripe as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. horizontalstripe: sets horizontal stripe as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart. bubble: sets bubble as highlighting pattern to accumulation chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart.IsMultiSelect
member.summary: If set true, enables the multi selection in accumulation chart. It requires `SelectionMode` to be `Point`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart.SelectionMode
member.summary: Specifies whether point has to get selected or not. Takes chartItems either 'None 'or 'Point'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfAccumulationChart.SelectionPattern
member.summary: Specifies whether series or data point for accumulation chart has to be selected. They are, none: sets none as selecting pattern to accumulation chart . chessboard: sets chess board as selecting pattern accumulation chart . dots: sets dots as selecting pattern accumulation chart . diagonalForward: sets diagonal forward as selecting pattern to accumulation chart . crosshatch: sets crosshatch as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. pacman: sets pacman selecting pattern to accumulation chart. diagonalbackward: sets diagonal backward as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. grid: sets grid as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. turquoise: sets turquoise as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. star: sets star as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. triangle: sets triangle as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. circle: sets circle as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. tile: sets tile as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. horizontaldash: sets horizontal dash as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. verticaldash: sets vertical dash as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. rectangle: sets rectangle as selecting pattern. box: sets box as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. verticalstripe: sets vertical stripe as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. horizontalstripe: sets horizontal stripe as selecting pattern to accumulation chart. bubble: sets bubble as selecting pattern to accumulation chart.

member.summary: Enables the scrollbar for zooming.

member.summary: Specifies the types like `Years`, `Months`, `Days`, `Hours`, `Minutes`, `Seconds` in date time axis.They are, Auto: Defines the interval of the axis based on data. Years: Defines the interval of the axis in years. Months: Defines the interval of the axis in months. Days: Defines the interval of the axis in days. Hours: Defines the interval of the axis in hours. Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the interval for an axis.

member.summary: Specifies the minimum range of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.Maximum
member.summary: Specifies the maximum range of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.ZoomFactor
member.summary: The axis is scaled by this factor. When zoomFactor is 0.5, the chart is scaled by 200% along this axis. Value ranges from 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.ZoomPosition
member.summary: Position of the zoomed axis. Value ranges from 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelFormat
member.summary: Used to format the axis label that accepts any global string format like 'C', 'n1', 'P' etc. It also accepts placeholder like '{value}°C' in which value represent the axis label, e.g, 20°C.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `None`, `Hide`, `Trim`, `Wrap`, `MultipleRows`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Trim: Trim the label when it intersects. Wrap: Wrap the label when it intersects. MultipleRows: Shows the label in MultipleRows when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.Position
member.summary: Position of the legend in the chart are, Auto: Places the legend based on area type. Top: Displays the legend at the top of the chart. Left: Displays the legend at the left of the chart. Bottom: Displays the legend at the bottom of the chart. Right: Displays the legend at the right of the chart. Custom: Displays the legend based on the given x and y values.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis
member.summary: To specify customization options for stockchart axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.CrossesAt
member.summary: Specifies the value at which the axis line has to be intersect with the vertical axis or vice versa.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.CrossesInAxis
member.summary: Specifies axis name with which the axis line has to be crossed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Description
member.summary: Description for axis and its element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.DesiredIntervals
member.summary: With this property, you can request axis to calculate intervals approximately equal to your specified interval.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.EdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the position of labels at the edge of the axis.They are, None: No action will be performed. Hide: Edge label will be hidden. Shift: Shifts the edge labels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.EnableAutoIntervalOnZooming
member.summary: If set to true, axis interval will be calculated automatically with respect to the zoomed range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.EnableTrim
member.summary: Specifies the Trim property for an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the interval for an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.IntervalType
member.summary: Specifies the types like `Years`, `Months`, `Days`, `Hours`, `Minutes`, `Seconds` in date time axis.They are, Auto: Defines the interval of the axis based on data. Years: Defines the interval of the axis in years. Months: Defines the interval of the axis in months. Days: Defines the interval of the axis in days. Hours: Defines the interval of the axis in hours. Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.IsInversed
member.summary: It specifies whether the axis to be rendered in inversed manner or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LabelFormat
member.summary: Used to format the axis label that accepts any global string format like 'C', 'n1', 'P' etc. It also accepts placeholder like '{value}°C' in which value represent the axis label, e.g, 20°C.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `Hide`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LabelPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the placement of a label for category axis. They are, betweenTicks: Renders the label between the ticks. onTicks: Renders the label on the ticks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LabelPosition
member.summary: Specifies the placement of a labels to the axis line. They are, inside: Renders the labels inside to the axis line. outside: Renders the labels outside to the axis line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LabelRotation
member.summary: The angle to which the axis label gets rotated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.LogBase
member.summary: The base value for logarithmic axis. It requires `ValueType` to be `Logarithmic`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Maximum
member.summary: Specifies the maximum range of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.MaximumLabelWidth
member.summary: Specifies the maximum width of an axis label.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.MaximumLabels
member.summary: The maximum number of label count per 100 pixels with respect to the axis length.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Minimum
member.summary: Specifies the minimum range of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.MinorTicksPerInterval
member.summary: Specifies the number of minor ticks per interval.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Name
member.summary: Unique identifier of an axis. To associate an axis with the series, set this name to the xAxisName/yAxisName properties of the series.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.OpposedPosition
member.summary: If set to true, the axis will render at the opposite side of its default position.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.PlaceNextToAxisLine
member.summary: Specifies whether axis elements like axis labels, axis title, etc has to be crossed with axis line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.PlotOffset
member.summary: Left and right padding for the plot area in pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.RangePadding
member.summary: Specifies the padding for the axis range in terms of interval.They are, none: Padding cannot be applied to the axis. normal: Padding is applied to the axis based on the range calculation. additional: Interval of the axis is added as padding to the minimum and maximum values of the range. round: Axis range is rounded to the nearest possible value divided by the interval.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.RowIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the row where the axis is associated, when the chart area is divided into multiple plot areas by using `Rows`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Skeleton
member.summary: Specifies the skeleton format in which the dateTime format will process.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.SkeletonType
member.summary: It specifies the type of format to be used in dateTime format process.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Span
member.summary: Specifies the number of `Columns` or `rows` an axis has to span horizontally or vertically.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.StartAngle
member.summary: The start angle for the series.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.TabIndex
member.summary: TabIndex value for the axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: Specifies the placement of a ticks to the axis line. They are, inside: Renders the ticks inside to the axis line. outside: Renders the ticks outside to the axis line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.Title
member.summary: Specifies the title of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.ValueType
member.summary: Specifies the type of data the axis is handling. Double: Renders a numeric axis. DateTime: Renders a dateTime axis. Category: Renders a category axis. Logarithmic: Renders a log axis.

member.summary: If set to true, axis label will be visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.StockChartCommonAxis.ZoomFactor
member.summary: The axis is scaled by this factor. When zoomFactor is 0.5, the chart is scaled by 200% along this axis. Value ranges from 0 to 1.

member.summary: Position of the zoomed axis. Value ranges from 0 to 1.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors
member.summary:
Specifies the data adaptors.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.summary: JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.QueryableExtensions.Where(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object,Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.FilterType,System.Boolean,System.Type)
M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.QueryableExtensions.Where(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Linq.Expressions.ParameterExpression,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary:
Use this function to generate WHERE expression based on Predicates. The AndPredicate and OrPredicate should be used in combination to build the predicate expression which is finally passed on to this function for creating a Lambda.
DataClasses1DataContext db = new DataClasses1DataContext();.
var orders = db.Orders.Skip(0).Take(100).ToList();.
var queryable = orders.AsQueryable();.
var parameter = queryable.Parameter("ShipCountry");.
var binaryExp = queryable.Predicate(parameter,.
"ShipCountry", "USA", true);.
var filteredOrders = queryable.Where(parameter, binaryExp);.
foreach (var order in filteredOrders).
{.
Console.WriteLine(order);.
}.
Build Predicates for Contains / StartsWith / EndsWith,.
IQueryable queryable = nw.Orders.AsQueryable();.
var parameter = queryable.Parameter();.
var exp1 = queryable.Predicate(parameter, "ShipCountry", "h", FilterType.Contains);.
var exp2 = queryable.Predicate(parameter, "ShipCountry", "a", FilterType.StartsWith);.
var andExp = exp2.OrPredicate(exp1);.
var filters = queryable.Where(parameter, andExp);.
foreach (Orders item in filters).
{.
Console.WriteLine("{0}/{1}", item.OrderID, item.ShipCountry);.
}.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BaseComponent
member.summary: A Base Component for all the Syncfusion Blazor UI components.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
member.summary: The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications. It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.HttpClientInstance
member.summary: Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used by DataManager.
member.remarks: Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Url
member.summary: Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance
member.summary: Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
member.remarks: DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance. Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach. To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.summary: Specifies the insert URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl. If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the remove URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl. If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.UpdateUrl

member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl. If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.CrudUrl
member.summary: Specifies the CRUD URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl. If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.BatchUrl
member.summary: Specifies the batch url.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl. If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PathElement
member.summary: Represents the class which defines how to align the path based on offsetX and offsetY.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" @bind-Nodes="Nodes" SetNodeTemplate="SetTemplate">
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            { 
              DiagramObjectCollection<Node> Nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
              private ICommonElement SetTemplate(IDiagramObject node)
              {
                if ((node as Node).ID == "node2")
                {
                  Canvas container = new Canvas();
                  PathElement diagramElement = new PathElement();
                  diagramElement.Style.Fill = "green";
                  diagramElement.Data = "M150 0 L75 200 L225 200 Z";
                  container.Children.Add(diagramElement);
                  return container;
                }
                return null;
              }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextElement
member.summary: Represents the text element which is used to display text or annotations.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px" @bind-Nodes="Nodes" SetNodeTemplate="SetTemplate">
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            { 
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> Nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                private ICommonElement SetTemplate(IDiagramObject node)
                {
                    if ((node as Node).ID == "node2")
                    {
                        Canvas container = new Canvas();
                        TextElement textElement = new TextElement();
                        textElement.Content = "node2content";
                        container.Children.Add(textElement);
                        return container;
                    }
                     return null;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings
member.summary: Specifies how to customize the appearance, width, and height of the diagram page.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="500px" Nodes="@nodes" Connectors="@connectors">
                <PageSettings Width = "@PageWidth" Height="@PageHeight" Orientation="@pageOrientation" MultiplePage="@IsMultiplePage" ShowPageBreaks="@IsShowPageBreaks">
                    <PageMargin Left = "@marginLeft" Right="@marginRight" Top="@marginTop" Bottom="@marginBottom"></PageMargin>
                </PageSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                double PageWidth = 300;
                double PageHeight = 300;
                PageOrientation pageOrientation = PageOrientation.Landscape;
                bool IsMultiplePage = true;
                bool IsShowPageBreaks = true;
                double marginLeft = 10;
                double marginRight = 10;
                double marginTop = 10;
                double marginBottom = 10;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes; DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors;
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>()
                    {
                        new Node { ID = "node1", Width = 150, Height = 100, OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node1" } } },
                        new Node { ID = "node2", Width = 80, Height = 130, OffsetX = 200, OffsetY = 200, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node2" } } },
                        new Node { ID = "node3", Width = 100, Height = 75, OffsetX = 300, OffsetY = 350, Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>() { new ShapeAnnotation() { Content = "Node3" } } }
                    };
                    connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> 
                    {
                        new Connector { ID="connector1", SourcePoint=new DiagramPoint { X=300, Y=400}, TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint { X = 500, Y = 500 } }
                    };
                }
            }

member.summary: Gets or sets the child content of the page settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the diagram page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the diagram page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the page in the diagram. By default, the orientation of the page is set to landscape.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.BoundaryConstraints
member.summary: Allows the user to customize the interactive region.
member.remarks: The boundary constraints property restricts or customizes the interactive region, out of which the elements cannot be dragged, resized or rotated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.MultiplePage
member.summary: Allows users to enable or disable multiple pages.
member.remarks: When multiple pages are enabled, the size of the page dynamically increases or decreases to split the single page into multiple pages and completely fit the diagram within the page boundaries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.ShowPageBreaks
member.summary: Allows the user to enable or disable the page break lines.
member.remarks: The ShowPageBreaks property is used as a visual guide to see how pages are split into multiple pages. By default, it is false. If it is true, then the page break lines will be visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Margin
member.summary: Specifies the extra space around the diagram content. The default values for the margin are set to 25 on all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PageSettings.Background
member.summary: Defines the page background.
member.remarks: Users can customize the background of the diagram page by using the background property. The Source property of background allows the user to set the path of the image to the background, whereas the Color property of the background allows the user to set a color to the background of the diagram page. By default, it is set to transparent.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ScrollSettings
member.summary: Sets the diagram's current zoom value, zoom factor, scroll state, and viewport size.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px">
                <ScrollSettings @bind-VerticalOffset="@verticalOffset" @bind-HorizontalOffset="@horizontalOffset" @bind-ScrollLimit="@scrollLimit" @bind-CurrentZoom="@currentZoom" @bind-MinZoom="minZoom" @bind-MaxZoom="@maxZoom">
                </ScrollSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>    
            @code
            {
                double verticalOffset { get; set; } = 300;
                double horizontalOffset { get; set; } = -1000;
                ScrollLimitMode scrollLimit { get; set; } = ScrollLimitMode.Infinity;
                double currentZoom { get; set; } = 1;
                double minZoom { get; set; } = 0.2;
                double maxZoom { get; set; } = 1.5;
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.GridLines
member.summary: Represents the visual guidance while dragging or arranging the objects.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="500px">
                <SnapSettings Constraints="SnapConstraints.ShowLines">
                    <HorizontalGridLines LineColor="blue" LineDashArray="2,2" LineIntervals="@LineInterval">
                    </HorizontalGridLines>
                    <VerticalGridLines LineColor="blue" LineDashArray="2,2" LineIntervals="@LineInterval">
                    </VerticalGridLines>
                </SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               //Set the line intervals for the gridlines
               public double[] LineInterval { get; set; } = new double[] 
               {
                    1.25, 14, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15, 0.25, 15
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Represents the alignment of the diagram elements based on its immediate parent.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                public DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>() { };
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    // A node is created and stored in nodes array.
                    Node Node = new Node()
                    {
                        /// Initialize the port collection
                        Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
                        {
                            new PointPort()
                            {
                                HorizontalAlignment = HorizontalAlignment.Left
                            }
                        },
                    };
                    nodes.Add(Node);
                }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.HorizontalAlignment.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch the diagram element horizontally to its immediate parent.

member.summary: Align the diagram element horizontally to the left side of its immediate parent.

member.summary: Align the diagram element horizontally to the right side of its immediate parent.

member.summary: Align the diagram element horizontally to the center of its immediate parent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.HorizontalAlignment.Auto
member.summary: Aligns the diagram element based on its immediate parent’s horizontal alignment property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.GridType
member.summary: Specifies the type of gridlines.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="500px">
                <SnapSettings GridType = "GridType.Dots" >
                    <HorizontalGridLines LineColor="Blue" @bind-LineIntervals="@HInterval"
                                      @bind-DotIntervals="@HDotInterval"></HorizontalGridLines>
                    <VerticalGridLines LineColor = "Blue" @bind-LineIntervals="@VInterval"
                                     @bind-DotIntervals="@VDotInterval"></VerticalGridLines>
                </SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               public double[] HDotInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 3, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20 };
               public double[] VDotInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 3, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20, 1, 20 };
               public double[] HInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 1.25, 18.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75 };
               public double[] VInterval { get; set; } = new double[] { 1.25, 18.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75, 0.25, 19.75 };
            }

<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                public DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>() { };
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    // A node is created and stored in nodes array.
                    Node Node = new Node()
                    {
                        /// Initialize the port collection
                        Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
                        {
                            new PointPort()
                            {
                                VerticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Top
                            }

                    };
                    nodes.Add(Node);

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextWrap.WrapWithOverflow
member.summary: Text-wrapping occurs when the text overflows beyond the available node width. However, the text may overflow beyond the node width in case of a very long word.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.TextWrap.NoWrap

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the ports.
member.remarks: To know more about using port shapes, refer to the Ports. To apply the X port shape, use the below code

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code{
              DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
                //Initialize the NodeCollection.
                nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                Node Node = new Node()
                {
                  ID = "node1",
                  Height = 100,
                  Width = 100,
                  OffsetX = 100,
                  OffsetY = 100,
                };
                Node.Ports = new DiagramObjectCollection<PointPort>()
                {
                 new PointPort()
                 {
                     ID="port1",
                     Offset=new DiagramPoint(){X=0,Y=0.5},
                     Shape=PortShapes.X,
                     Visibility=PortVisibility.Hover|PortVisibility.Connect,
                     //set the PortConstraints...
                     Constraints=PortConstraints.Draw
                  }
                };
                nodes.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.X
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to X.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Circle
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Circle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Square
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Square.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PortShapes.Custom
member.summary: Sets the shape of the port to Custom.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.FlowShapeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of process flow shape.
member.remarks: To learn more about using flow shapes, refer Shapes.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Shape = new FlowShape()
                        {
                            Type = Shapes.Flow,
                            Shape = FlowShapesType.DirectData
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="500px" Connectors="@connectors">
                <SnapSettings Constraints = "@snapConstraints" ></SnapSettings>
            </SfDiagramComponent >
            @code
            {
                SnapConstraints snapConstraints = SnapConstraints.None;
                //Define the diagram's connector collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Connector Connector = new Connector()
                    {
                        ID = "connector1",
                        // Set the source and target point of the connector
                        SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                        TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                        // Type of the connector segment
                        Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Straight,
                        TargetDecorator = new DecoratorSettings()
                        {
                            Shape = DecoratorShape.Arrow,
                            Style = new ShapeStyle()
                            {
                                Fill = "#6f409f",
                                StrokeColor = "#6f409f",
                                StrokeWidth = 1
                            }
                        }
                    };
                    connectors.Add(Connector);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Direction
member.summary: Specifies the orthogonal connector's connection segment direction.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px"  @bind-Connectors="@connectors">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                public DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();    
                Connector connector = new Connector()
                {
                    ID = "connector",
                    SourceID = "node13",
                    TargetID = "node14",
                    Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal,
                    Segments = new DiagramObjectCollection<ConnectorSegment>() 
                    { 
                        new OrthogonalSegment() 
                        { 
                            Length = 70, 
                            Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal, 
                            Direction = Direction.Right 
                        }, 
                        new OrthogonalSegment() 
                        { 
                            Length = 20, 
                            Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal, 
                            Direction = Direction.Bottom 
                        } 
                    }
                };
                connectors.Add(connector);
            }
