member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType
member.summary: Specifies the collection of sub tree alignments in an organizational chart.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height = "600px" NodeCreating="@NodeDefaults" ConnectorCreating="@ConnectorDefaults">
                <DataSourceSettings ID = "Id" ParentID="Team" DataSource="@DataSource"></DataSourceSettings>   
                <Layout Type = "LayoutType.OrganizationalChart"
                        @bind-HorizontalSpacing="@HorizontalSpacing" 
                        @bind-VerticalSpacing="@VerticalSpacing" 
                        GetLayoutInfo="GetLayoutInfo">
                </Layout>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               int HorizontalSpacing = 40;
               int VerticalSpacing = 50;
               private TreeInfo GetLayoutInfo(IDiagramObject obj, TreeInfo options)
               {
                    options.AlignmentType = SubTreeAlignmentType.Alternate;
                    options.Orientation = Orientation.Vertical;
                    return options;         
               }
               private void ConnectorDefaults(IDiagramObject connector)
               {
                   (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                   (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.None;
                   (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                   (connector as Connector).Constraints = 0;
                   (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
               }
               private void NodeDefaults(IDiagramObject obj)
               {
                   Node node = obj as Node;
                   node.Height = 50;
                   node.Width = 150;
                   node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED", StrokeWidth = 1, StrokeColor = "Black" };
               }
               public class OrgChartDataModel 
               {
                   public string Id  { get; set; }
                   public string Team { get; set; }
                   public string Role { get; set; }
               }
               public object DataSource = new List<object>()
               {
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "1", Role= "General Manager" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "2", Role= "Human Resource Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "3", Role= "Design Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "4", Role= "Operation Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "5", Role= "Marketing Manager", Team= "1" }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Left
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the left of the parent in a horizontal/vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Right
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the right of the parent in a horizontal/vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Center
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at the center of the parent in a horizontal sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Alternate
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes alternatively on both left and right sides in a vertical sub tree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SubTreeAlignmentType.Balanced
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes horizontally to balance the width and height of the sub tree.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the automatic layout.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@Diagram" Height="499px" InteractionController="@InteractionController.ZoomPan" ConnectorCreating="@ConnectorDefaults" NodeCreating="@NodeDefaults">
                <DataSourceSettings ID = "Name" ParentID="Category" DataSource="DataSource"> </DataSourceSettings>
                    <Layout @bind-Type="type" @bind-HorizontalSpacing="@HorizontalSpacing" @bind-Orientation="@orientation" @bind-VerticalSpacing="@VerticalSpacing" @bind-HorizontalAlignment="@horizontalAlignment" @bind-VerticalAlignment="@verticalAlignment" GetLayoutInfo="GetLayoutInfo">                
                    </Layout>            
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               SfDiagramComponent Diagram;
               public int? HValue { get; set; } = 30;
               public int? VValue { get; set; } = 30;
               LayoutType type = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree;
               LayoutOrientation orientation = LayoutOrientation.TopToBottom;
               HorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment = HorizontalAlignment.Auto;
               VerticalAlignment verticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto;
               int HorizontalSpacing = 30;
               int VerticalSpacing = 30;
               private void ConnectorDefaults(IDiagramObject connector)
               {
                   (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                   (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.None;
                   (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                   (connector as Connector).Constraints = 0;
                   (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
               }
               private TreeInfo GetLayoutInfo(IDiagramObject obj, TreeInfo options)
               {
                   options.EnableSubTree = true;
                   options.Orientation = Orientation.Horizontal;
                   return options;
               }
               private void NodeDefaults(IDiagramObject obj)
               {
                   Node node = obj as Node;
                   if (node.Data is System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
                   {
                       node.Data = System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.Deserialize<HierarchicalDetails>(node.Data.ToString());
                   }
                   HierarchicalDetails hierarchicalData = node.Data as HierarchicalDetails;
                   node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#659be5", StrokeColor = "none", StrokeWidth = 2, };
                   node.BackgroundColor = "#659be5";
                   node.Width = 150;
                   node.Height = 50;
                   node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
                   {
                       new ShapeAnnotation()
                       {
                           Content = hierarchicalData.Name,
                           Style =new TextStyle(){Color = "white"}
                       }
                   };
               }
               public class HierarchicalDetails 
               {
                   public string Name { get; set; }
                   public string FillColor { get; set; }
                   public string Category { get; set; }
               }
               public List<HierarchicalDetails> DataSource = new List<HierarchicalDetails>()
               {
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram", Category="",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree layout", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational chart", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Hierarchical tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Radial tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Mind map", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.InteractionController
member.summary: Allows the users to customize the selection, zooming, and interaction behavior of the diagram.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Width="1000px"  Height="1000px" InteractionController="Tools" DrawingObject="@DrawingObject" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
               SfDiagramComponent diagram;
               InteractionController Tools = InteractionController.ContinuousDraw;
               IDiagramObject DrawingObject { get; set; }
               DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   Node node = new Node()
                   {
                       Shape = new FlowShape() { Type = Shapes.Flow, Shape = FlowShapeType.Decision }
                   };
                   DrawingObject = node;
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CollectionChangedAction
member.summary: Specifies whether an object is added/removed from the diagram.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px" SelectionChanging="@OnSelectionChanging">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                private void OnSelectionChanging(SelectionChangingEventArgs args)
                {
                    if ((args != null) && (args.NewValue != null) && (args.OldValue != null))
                    {
                        CollectionChangedAction type = args.Type;
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Represents the final step of the process.

member.summary: Represents the continuing once along with the trigger type.

member.summary: Sets the type of the task to None.

member.summary: Represents the process is started, it is facilitated, or it is completed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Link
member.summary: Represents a sub-process that is a component of a bigger process.

member.summary: Represents an error trigger that will always interrupt the process that is contained in it.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Compensation
member.summary: Represents a refund that occurs when procedures are partially successful.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Signal
member.summary: Represents a signal that is shared by several processes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Multiple

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Parallel
member.summary: Represents an instance of a process that does not begin, continue, or finish until all the potential events have occurred.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Cancel
member.summary: Represents the cancelling of process.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Conditional
member.summary: Represents a process that begins or continues when a business condition or business rule is met.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.BpmnTriggers.Terminate
member.summary: Represents a process step to be immediately terminated.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ModifierKeys
member.summary: Specifies a combination of key modifiers, on recognition of which the command will be executed.

example.code:
<summary>
            Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.
            </remarks>
            <example>
            <code lang="Razor">
            <![CDATA[
            <SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        DiagramSelectionSettings selector = diagram.SelectionSettings;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is NodeGroup)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as NodeGroup).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Specifies when no modifiers are pressed.

member.summary: Specifies the Ctrl key as a key modifier.

member.summary: Specifies the alt key as a key modifier.

<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" HistoryChanged="@OnHistoryChanged">

            private void OnHistoryChanged(HistoryChangedEventArgs arg)
            {

                {
                    HistoryChangedAction historyChangeArgs = arg.ActionTrigger;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.PropertyChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the PropertyChanged event.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" Nodes="@nodes" Connectors="@connectors" PropertyChanged="@PropertyChanged">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            { 
              private void PropertyChanged(PropertyChangedEventArgs args)
              {
                if ((args != null) && (args.Element != null) && (args.NewValue != null) && (args.OldValue != null))
                {
                  Console.WriteLine("Changed");
                }
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DraggingEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when an element drags over another diagram element.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" Dragging="Dragging">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            private void Dragging(DraggingEventArgs args)
            {
                if (args.Element is DiagramSelectionSettings)
                {
                    DiagramSelectionSettings selector = args.Element as DiagramSelectionSettings;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DragStartEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when the element enters into the diagram from the symbol palette.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="1000px" Height="1000px" DragStart="DragStart">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            private void DragStart(DragStartEventArgs args)
            {
                if (args.Element is Node)
                {
                    (args.Element as Node).Width = 300;
                    (args.Element as Node).Height = 300;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangingEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when the element is resizing.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" SizeChanging="@OnSizeChange" />
            @code
            {
                // To define the node collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                    // A node is created and stored in the nodes collection.
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        // Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 250,
                        OffsetY = 250,
                        // Size of the node
                        Width = 100,
                        Height = 100,
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" }
                    };
                    // Add a node
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
                // Size change event for the diagram
                public void OnSizeChange(SizeChangingEventArgs args)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine(args.NewValue.Nodes[0].ID);
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicates whether to cancel the change or not

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Notifies when the element is resized.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" SizeChanged="@SizeChanged" />
            @code
            {
                // To define the node collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes;
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                    // A node is created and stored in the nodes collection.
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        // Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 250,
                        OffsetY = 250,
                        // Size of the node
                        Width = 100,
                        Height = 100,
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" }
                    };
                    // Add a node
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
                // Size change event for the diagram
                public void SizeChanged(SizeChangedEventArgs args)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine(args.NewValue.Nodes[0].ID);
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangedEventArgs.Element
member.summary: Returns the element which has been selected for the resizing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SizeChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: Returns the new width, height, offsetX and offsetY values of the element that is resized

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CommandKeyArgs
member.summary: Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
member.remarks: The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@ 
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            { 
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                    new KeyboardCommand()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, Modifiers = ModifierKeys.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.Modifiers == ModifierKeys.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        DiagramSelectionSettings selector = diagram.SelectionSettings;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is NodeGroup)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as NodeGroup).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Specifies the name of the command.

member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the fixed user handle. By default, it is aligned at the center.
member.remarks:
The below list explains the alignment options.
1. Center, aligns the fixedUserHandle on the connector segment.
2. Before, aligns the fixedUserHandle on top of a connector segment.
3. After, aligns the fixedUserHandle at the bottom of a connector segment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.Undo
member.summary: The method will be called when the custom entry is in undo stage.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                 <DiagramHistoryManager Undo="onCustomUndo"></DiagramHistoryManager>
             </SfDiagramComponent >
             @code
             {
                 private void onCustomUndo(HistoryEntryBase entry)
                 {
                     (entry.RedoObject) = entry.UndoObject.Clone() as Node;
                     (entry.UndoObject as Node).AdditionalInfo[(entry.UndoObject as Node).ID] = "Start";
                 }
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.Redo
member.summary: The method will be called when the custom entry is in the redo stage.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                <DiagramHistoryManager Redo="onCustomRedo"></DiagramHistoryManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                private void onCustomRedo(HistoryEntryBase entry)
                {
                    Node current = entry.UndoObject.Clone() as Node;
                    (entry.UndoObject as Node).AdditionalInfo[(entry.UndoObject as Node).ID] = "Description";
                    entry.RedoObject = current;
                }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DiagramHistoryManager.StartGroupAction
member.summary: History allows you to revert or restore multiple changes through a single undo/redo command. It is used to start the grouping of changes.

example.code: //Start the grouping of changes diagram.StartGroupAction();

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width="800px" Height="800px">
                 <DiagramHistoryManager HistoryAdding="OnHistoryAdding"></DiagramHistoryManager>
             </SfDiagramComponent>
             @code
             {

                 {

                 }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.ConnectorSegment
member.summary: Represents the segment of the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Connectors="@connectors">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
              public DiagramObjectCollection<Connector> connectors = new DiagramObjectCollection<Connector>();
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
                Connector connector = new Connector()
                {
                   ID="straight",
                   SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 100, Y = 200 },
                   TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint() { X = 300, Y = 200 },
                   Segments = new DiagramObjectCollection<ConnectorSegment>()
                   {
                       //Create a new straight segment 
                       new StraightSegment(){Point=new DiagramPoint(420,300)},
                    }
                };
               connectors.Add(connector);
              }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.DataSourceSettings
member.summary: DataSourceSettings is used to specify the data source and defines how the parent and child relationship will be generated in the layout. It is applicable only when the layout is used.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Width = "1000px" Height="1000px">
            <DataSourceSettings @bind-DataSource="@data" ID="@Id" ParentID="@ParentId" SymbolMapping="@doBinding"></DataSourceSettings>
            <Layout Type = "LayoutType" >
            </ Layout >
            </ SfDiagramComponent >
            @code {
            public object data { get; set; }
            public string Id;
            public string ParentId;
            public LayoutType LayoutType = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree;
            protected override void OnInitialized()
            {
             Id = "Name";
             ParentId = "Category";
             data = Data1;
            }
            //bind the external data with the node
            private Node doBinding(Node node, object data)
            {
             HierarchicalDetails hierarchicalData = data as HierarchicalDetails;
             node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
            {
             new ShapeAnnotation()
            {
             ID = "annotation"+node.ID,
             Content = hierarchicalData.Name,
            },
            };
            return node;
            }
            public List<HierarchicalDetails> Data1 = new List<HierarchicalDetails>()
            {
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram",FillColor="#916DAF"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree Layout",Category="Layout"},
             new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational Chart", Category="Layout"}
            };
            public class HierarchicalDetails
            {
             public string Name { get; set; }
             public string Category { get; set; }
             public string FillColor { get; set; }
            }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.CommandManager
member.summary: Defines the collection of commands and the corresponding key gestures. It is responsible for managing routed commands.
member.remarks: CommandManager provides the support to define custom commands. The custom commands are executed when the specified key gesture is recognized.

example.code:
<summary>
            Notifies when to execute the custom keyboard commands .
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The following code illustrates how to create a custom command.
            </remarks>
            <example>
            <code lang="Razor">
            <![CDATA[
            <SfDiagramComponent @ref="@diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes">
            @* Initializing the custom commands*@
                <CommandManager Commands = "@command" Execute="@CommandExecute" CanExecute="@canexe">
                </CommandManager>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                // Reference to the diagram
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand> command = new DiagramObjectCollection<KeyboardCommand>()
                {
                    new Command()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.G, KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Control }
                    },
                    new Command()
                    {
                        Name = "CustomUnGroup",
                        Gesture = new KeyGesture() { Key = Keys.U, KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Control }
                    },
                };
                // Define the diagram's nodes collection
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                public void canexe(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    args.CanExecute = true;
                }
                public void CommandExecute(CommandKeyArgs args)
                {
                    if (args.Gesture.KeyModifiers == KeyModifiers.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.G)
                    {
                        //Custom command to group the selected nodes
                        diagram.Group();
                    }
                    if (args.Gesture.KeyModifiers == KeyModifiers.Control && args.Gesture.Key == Keys.U)
                    {
                        Selector selector = diagram.SelectedItems;
                        //Custom command to ungroup the selected items
                        if (selector.Nodes.Count > 0 && selector.Nodes[0] is Group)
                        {
                            if ((selector.Nodes[0] as Group).Children.Length > 0)
                            {
                                diagram.UnGroup();
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

member.summary: Represents the appearance of an annotation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text to the parent node/connector.

tr.td: The following options are used to define the Horizontal Alignment of the annotation.
1. Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout the node.
2. Left - Aligns the diagram element at the left of the node.
3. Right - Aligns the diagram element at the right of the node.
4. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the node.
5. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the text to the parent node/connector.

tr.td: The following options are used to define the Vertical Alignment of the annotation.
1. Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout the node.
2. Top - Aligns the diagram element at the top of the node.
3. Bottom - Aligns the diagram element at the bottom of the node.
4. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the node.
5. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.Margin

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Annotation.DragLimit

member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of PointPort (connection points).

member.summary: Represents the collection of textual information contained in the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.FixedUserHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of the fixed user handle of the node.
member.remarks: The fixed user handles are used to add some frequently used commands around the node and connector even without selecting it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Pivot
member.summary: Node rotation angle will be based on pivot values which range from 0 to 1 like offset values. By default, the Pivot values are set to X= 0.5 and Y=0.5.
member.remarks:
The below list explains the pivot values.
1. When X= 0 and Y= 0, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the top-left corner of the node.
2. When X= 0.5 and Y= 0.5, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the node’s center point.
3. When X= 1 and Y= 1, OffsetX and OffsetY values are considered to be at the bottom-right corner of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Width

member.remarks: The width of a node does not include borders or margins.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Style
member.summary: Represents the appearance of the node.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() 
                        {
                            Fill = "#6BA5D7", 
                            StrokeDashArray = "5,5", 
                            StrokeColor = "red", 
                            StrokeWidth = 2 
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadow appearance of a node.
member.remarks: The Shadow effect on a node is disabled by default. It can be enabled with the constraint property of the node. The Angle, Distance, and Opacity of the shadow can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the node's background color. By default, it is transparent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the border color of the node. By default, it is black.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.BorderWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width of the node. By default, it is 1px.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Data
member.summary: Returns the record of the data source as data. Each record on the data source represents a node in an automatic layout.
member.remarks: Nodes can be generated automatically with the information provided through the data. This is applicable only while using an automatic layout. You can get the datasource details in a node through the data.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" NodeCreating="@OnNodeCreating" ConnectorCreating="@OnConnectorCreating">
                <DataSourceSettings Id = "Id" ParentId="ParentId" DataSource="@DataSource"/>
                    <Layout Type = "LayoutType.MindMap" >
                        < LayoutMargin Top="20" Left="20"/>
                    </Layout>
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            
            @code
            {
                private void OnNodeCreating(IDiagramObject obj)
                {
                    Node node = obj as Node;
                    node.Height = 100;
                    node.Width = 100;
                    node.BackgroundColor = "#6BA5D7";
                    node.Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED", StrokeWidth = 1, StrokeColor = "white" };
                    node.Shape = new BasicShape() { Type = Shapes.Basic };
                    MindMapDetails mindmapData = node.Data as MindMapDetails;
                    node.Annotations = new DiagramObjectCollection<ShapeAnnotation>()
                    {
                        new ShapeAnnotation()
                        {
                            Content = mindmapData.Label
                        }
                    };
                }
                private void OnConnectorCreating(IDiagramObject connector)
                {
                    (connector as Connector).Type = ConnectorSegmentType.Orthogonal;
                    (connector as Connector).TargetDecorator.Shape = DecoratorShape.Arrow;
                    (connector as Connector).Style = new ShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" };
                    (connector as Connector).CornerRadius = 5;
                }
                //Business class
                public class MindMapDetails
                {
                    public string Id { get; set; }
                    public string Label { get; set; }
                    public string ParentId { get; set; }
                    public string Branch { get; set; }
                    public string Fill { get; set; }
                }
                public object DataSource = new List<object>()
                {
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "1",Label = "Creativity", ParentId = "", Branch = "Root"},
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "2",  Label = "Brainstorming", ParentId = "1", Branch = "Right" },
                    new MindMapDetails() { Id = "3",  Label = "Complementing", ParentId = "1", Branch = "Left" },
                };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometrical representation of a node.
member.remarks: The Diagram provides some built-in shapes, such as BasicShape, FlowShape, Path, etc. You can also add custom shapes to the node.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Shape = new FlowShape()
                        {
                            Type = Shapes.Flow,
                            Shape = FlowShapesType.DirectData
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Node.Constraints
member.summary: Enables or disables certain features of the node. By default, all the interactive functionalities are enabled.
member.remarks: Features like dragging, resizing, and rotation of the node can be disabled.

member.remarks: Describes how a node should be positioned or stretched in HorizontalAlignment.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.NodeGroup
member.summary: Represents a cluster of multiple nodes and connectors into a single element. It acts like a container for its children (nodes, groups, and connectors).

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height = "500px" @ref="diagram" Nodes="@nodes">
            </SfDiagramComponent>
            @code
            {
                SfDiagramComponent diagram;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node1 = createNode("node1", 100, 100);
                    Node node2 = createNode("node2", 300, 100);
                    NodeGroup groupnode = new NodeGroup();
                    // Grouping node 1 and node 2 into a single group
                    groupnode.Children = new string[] { "node1", "node2" };
                    nodes.Add(node1);
                    nodes.Add(node2);
                    nodes.Add(groupnode);
                }
                public Node createNode(string id, double offx, double offy)
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = id,
                        OffsetX = offx,
                        OffsetY = offy,
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        Style = new ShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6495ED" }
                    };
                    return node;
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port
member.summary: Represents a port or connection point of the node.
member.remarks: Ports act as the connection points of node and allow them to create connections with only those specific points. There may be any number of ports in a node. You can able to modify the ports appearance, visibility, positioning, and can add custom shapes to it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.#ctor(Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Port from the given Port.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Port.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.ID
member.summary: Represents the unique id of the diagram object.

tr.td: 1. The ID needs to be unique. While creating a port, the user should not use the same id to other ports.
2. The ID needs to be unique. While creating a port, the user should not use the same id to other ports.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Sets the horizontal alignment of the port with respect to its immediate parent(node/connector)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the port to its immediate parent(node/connector).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Margin
member.summary: Defines the space from the actual offset values of the port. The default values for the Margin are 0 on all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the port. By default, it is 12px.
member.remarks: The width of a port does not include borders or margins.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Height
member.summary: Sets the height of the port

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Style
member.summary: Represents the appearance of the port.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Shape
member.summary: Represents the shape (built-in shape) of the port. By default, it appears in Square shape.

tr.td: The below list of shape types is used to define the port shape.
1. X - Sets the shape to X.
2. Circle - Sets the shape to Circle.
3. Square - Sets the shape to Square.
4. Custom - Sets the shape to Custom..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Visibility
member.summary: Represents the visibility of the port. By default, the port becomes visible when the mouse hovers over the node.

tr.td: The below list of options is used to control the visibility of the ports.
1. Visible - Default value. The port is visible
2. Hidden - The port is hidden.
3. Hover - Shows the port when the mouse hovers a node.
4. Connect - Shows the port when a connection endpoint is dragged over a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.PathData
member.summary: Represents the custom geometry(shape) of the port.
member.remarks: To create a custom-shaped port, the user must set the shape to ‘custom’ and then the PathData. (A custom graphics path is a set of connected lines, curves, and other simple graphics objects, including rectangles, ellipses, and text. A path works as a single graphics object, so any effect applied to the graphic path will also be applied to the port..)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.Constraints

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.Port.AdditionalInfo

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.FlowShape
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the flow shape.

example.code:
<SfDiagramComponent Height="600px" Nodes="@nodes" />
             @code
             {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                DiagramObjectCollection<Node> nodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Node>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    Node node = new Node()
                    {
                        ID = "node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height = 100,
                        Width = 100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX = 100,
                        OffsetY = 100,
                        //Set the type of shape as flow
                        Shape = new FlowShape()
                        {
                            Type = Shapes.Flow,
                            Shape = FlowShapesType.DirectData
                        }
                    };
                    nodes.Add(node);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SymbolPalette.SfSymbolPaletteComponent
member.summary: Represents how to display a collection of palettes. The palette shows a set of nodes and connectors. It allows you to drag and drop the nodes and connectors into the diagram.

example.code:
<SfSymbolPaletteComponent Height="600px" Palettes="@Palettes" SymbolDragPreviewSize="@SymbolPreview" SymbolHeight="@symbolSizeHeight" GetSymbolInfo="GetSymbolInfo" SymbolWidth="@symbolSizeWidth" SymbolMargin="@SymbolMargin">
            </SfSymbolPaletteComponent >
            @code
            { 
                DiagramSize SymbolPreview;
                SymbolMargin SymbolMargin = new SymbolMargin { Left = 10, Right = 10, Top = 10, Bottom = 10 };
                double symbolSizeWidth;
                double symbolSizeHeight;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Palette> Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>();
                DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase> Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                private SymbolInfo GetSymbolInfo(IDiagramObject symbol)
                {
                    SymbolInfo SymbolInfo = new SymbolInfo();
                    SymbolInfo.Fit = true;
                    return SymbolInfo;
                }
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    SymbolPreview = new DiagramSize();
                    SymbolPreview.Width = 80;
                    SymbolPreview.Height = 80;
                    symbolSizeWidth = 50;
                    symbolSizeHeight = 50;
                    Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                    Node Tnode2 = new Node()
                    { 
                        ID = "node1", 
                        Shape = new FlowShape() { Type = Shapes.Flow, Shape = FlowShapeType.Decision } 
                    };
                    Tnodes.Add(Tnode2);
                    Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>()
                    {
                        new Palette(){Symbols =Tnodes,Title="Flow Shapes",ID="Flow Shapes" },
                    };
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SymbolPalette.SymbolInfo
member.summary: Represents the size and description of a symbol.

example.code:
<SfSymbolPaletteComponent Height="600px" Palettes="@Palettes" SymbolDragPreviewSize="@SymbolPreview" SymbolHeight="@symbolSizeHeight"  GetSymbolInfo="GetSymbolInfo" SymbolWidth="@symbolSizeWidth" SymbolMargin="@SymbolMargin">
            </SfSymbolPaletteComponent >
            @code
            { 
                DiagramSize SymbolPreview;
                SymbolMargin SymbolMargin = new SymbolMargin { Left = 10, Right = 10, Top = 10, Bottom = 10 };
                double symbolSizeWidth;
                double symbolSizeHeight;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Palette> Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>();
                DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase> Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                private SymbolInfo GetSymbolInfo(IDiagramObject symbol)
                {
                    SymbolInfo SymbolInfo = new SymbolInfo();
                    SymbolInfo.Fit = true;
                    return SymbolInfo;
                }
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    SymbolPreview = new DiagramSize();
                    SymbolPreview.Width = 80;
                    SymbolPreview.Height = 80;
                    symbolSizeWidth = 50;
                    symbolSizeHeight = 50;
                    Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                    Node Tnode2 = new Node()
                    { 
                        ID = "node1", 
                        Shape = new FlowShape() { Type = Shapes.Flow, Shape = FlowShapesType.Decision } 
                    };
                    Tnodes.Add(Tnode2);
                    Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>()
                    {
                        new Palette(){Symbols =Tnodes,Title="Flow Shapes",Id="Flow Shapes" },
                    };
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagram.SymbolPalette.SymbolDescription
member.summary: Represents the textual description of a symbol.

example.code:
<SfSymbolPaletteComponent Height="600px" Palettes="@Palettes" SymbolPreview="@SymbolPreview" SymbolHeight="@symbolSizeHeight"  GetSymbolInfo="GetSymbolInfo" SymbolWidth="@symbolSizeWidth" SymbolMargin="@SymbolMargin">
            </SfSymbolPaletteComponent >
            @code
            { 
                Size SymbolPreview;
                SymbolMargin SymbolMargin = new SymbolMargin { Left = 10, Right = 10, Top = 10, Bottom = 10 };
                double symbolSizeWidth;
                double symbolSizeHeight;
                DiagramObjectCollection<Palette> Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>();
                DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase> Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                private SymbolInfo GetSymbolInfo(IDiagramObject symbol)
                {
                    SymbolInfo SymbolInfo = new SymbolInfo();
                    SymbolInfo.Fit = true;
                    string text = null;
                    if (symbol is Node)
                    {
                        text = ((symbol as Node).Shape as Shape).Type.ToString() + (symbol as Node).ID;
                    }
                    SymbolInfo.Description = new SymbolDescription() { Text = text };
                    return SymbolInfo;
                }
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    SymbolPreview = new Size();
                    SymbolPreview.Width = 80;
                    SymbolPreview.Height = 80;
                    symbolSizeWidth = 50;
                    symbolSizeHeight = 50;
                    Tnodes = new DiagramObjectCollection<NodeBase>();
                    Node Tnode2 = new Node()
                    { 
                        ID = "node1", 
                        Shape = new FlowShape() { Type = Shapes.Flow, Shape = FlowShapesType.Decision } 
                    };
                    Tnodes.Add(Tnode2);
                    Palettes = new DiagramObjectCollection<Palette>()
                    {
                        new Palette(){Symbols =Tnodes,Title="Flow Shapes",Id="Flow Shapes" },
                    };
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.

The filter action retrieves matched items through the `Filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DropDownList. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DropDownList.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DropDownList. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.PopupHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.PopupWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the DropDownList allows the user to change the value.

summary.para: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.
It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.ActionFailureTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.

summary.para: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button.
When the clear button is clicked, `Value`, `Text`, and `Index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.ValueTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Width
member.summary:
Specifies the width of the component. By default, the component width sets based on the width of its parent container.
You can also set the width in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FilterType
member.summary: Determines on which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.

summary.para: When set to `false`, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions.
By default, consider the casing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Query
member.summary: Accepts the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the ChangeOnBlur property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.ClosePopupOnSelect
member.summary: Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.

summary.para: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the MultiSelect component.
It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.DelimiterChar
member.summary: Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.

summary.para: Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.
By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.
This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.
Enable or disable persisting MultiSelect state between page reloads.
If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
Auto The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary: Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.ItemsCount
member.summary: The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.

member.summary: Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.DelimiterChar
member.summary: Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.

summary.para: Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.
By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.
This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableSelectionOrder
member.summary: Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.FilterBarPlaceholder
member.summary: Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
Auto The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary: Hides the selected item from the list item.

member.summary:

If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are.
Clip Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.
Ellipsis Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
EllipsisWithTooltip Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.summary: Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.

member.summary: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode.EllipsisWithTooltip
member.summary: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType
member.summary:
ColumnQueryMode provides options to retrive data from the datasource.
All It retrives whole data source
Schema Retrives data for all the defined columns in grid from the data source.
ExcludeHidden Retrives data only for visible columns of grid from the data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.All
member.summary: Specifies that all columns should be queried from data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.Schema
member.summary: Specifies that only columns specified in the GridColumns component should be queried from data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.ExcludeHidden
member.summary: Specifies that exclude hidden columns specified in the GridColumns should be queried from data source.

member.summary:
Defines mode of cell selection.
Flow Default. Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows..
Box Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range

member.summary: Default. All the cells between start and end cell will be selected.

member.summary: Same as Box, but shows border during selection.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType
member.summary:
Defines type of checkbox selection. This helps to reset selection when CheckboxOnly property is enabled.
Default Default. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one.
ResetOnRowClick In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.summary: Default. Clicking row will not clear selection selection of the row.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType.ResetOnRowClick
member.summary: Clicking row will reset the row selection.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel
member.summary: Defines the Column model.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowEditing
member.summary: If AllowEditing set to false, then it disables editing of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If AllowFiltering set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If AllowGrouping set to false, then it disables grouping of a particular column. By default all columns are groupable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowReordering
member.summary: If AllowReordering set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowResizing
member.summary: If AllowResizing set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowSearching
member.summary: If AllowSearching set to false, then it disables Searching of a particular column. By default all columns allow Searching.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AllowSorting
member.summary: If AllowSorting set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.AutoFit
member.summary: If AutoFit set to true, then the particular column content width will be adjusted based on its content in the initial rendering itself. Setting this property as true is equivalent to calling autoFitColumns method in the dataBound event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Columns
member.summary: Used to render multiple header rows(stacked headers) on the Grid header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Commands
member.summary: commands provides an option to display command buttons in every cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.CustomAttributes
member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.DataSource
member.summary: Defines the column data source which will act as foreign data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.DefaultValue
member.summary: Defines default values for the component when adding a new record to the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If DisableHtmlEncode is set to true, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If DisplayAsCheckBox is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Edit
member.summary: Defines object to customize default edit cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.EditTemplate
member.summary: Defines the cell edit template that used as editor for a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.EditType
member.summary: Defines the type of component for editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.EnableGroupByFormat
member.summary: If EnableGroupByFormat set to true, then it groups the particular column by formatted values. By default no columns are group by format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The bounded columns can be sort, filter and group etc., If the field name contains “dot”, then it is considered as complex binding. the first character must be an alphabet and should not contain spaces and special characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Filter
member.summary: Defines the filter options to customize filtering for the particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.FilterBarTemplate
member.summary: The FilterBarTemplate is used to add a custom component instead of default input component for filter bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.FilterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the filter template/UI that used as filter for a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.ForeignKeyField
member.summary: Defines the mapping column name of the foreign data source. If it is not defined then the columns.field will be considered as mapping column name.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.ForeignKeyValue
member.summary: Defines the display column name from the foreign data source which will be obtained from comparing local and foreign data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.Formatter
member.summary: Defines the method which is used to achieve custom formatting from an external function. This function triggers before rendering of each cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the column template which is used to add customized element in the column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.HeaderText
member.summary: Defines the header text of column which is used to display in column header. If HeaderText is not defined, then field name value will be assigned to header text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.HeaderTextAlign
member.summary: Define the alignment of column header which is used to align the text of column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnModel.HideAtMedia
member.summary: Column visibility can change based on its Media Queries. HideAtMedia accepts only valid Media Queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-positioning the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon can be shown in the dialog’s title section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be closed on pressing the escape (ESC) key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If the EnableResize is true, the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.XValue
member.summary: Specifies the offset left value to position the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.YValue
member.summary: Specifies the offset top value to position the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.AnimationDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.AnimationDuration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.AnimationEffect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None.
