member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header at the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tabs component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Items
member.summary: A list of items that are used to configure the Tabs component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.LoadOn
member.summary: Specifies the modes for the Tab content. The possible modes are: `Dynamic` Load the Tab content dynamically, which is rendering its content when switching its header. `Init` Loads all the tab contents on initial loading. `Demand` Loads the Tab content when required but keeps the content once it is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode which will be applied when the Tabs exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements will be displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container will hold the items that can be placed within the available space and the rest of the items will be moved to the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance that applies when scrolling in Tab and enabled Scrollable mode.

member.summary: A class for a toolbar Item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Click
member.summary: Event triggers when `click` the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the template that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: A list of items that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Popup
member.summary: Popup - Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.MultiRow
member.summary: MultiRow - Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Extended
member.summary: Extended - Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode
member.summary: Specifies the options of where the text will be displayed in popup mode of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Both
member.summary: Both - Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Overflow
member.summary: Overflow - Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Toolbar
member.summary: Toolbar - Text will be displayed on Toolbar only.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign
member.summary: Specifies the options for aligning the Toolbar items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Left
member.summary: Left - To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Center
member.summary: Center - To align commands at the center of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Right
member.summary: Right - To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the options for supporting element types of Toolbar command.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Button
member.summary: Button - Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Separator
member.summary: Separator - Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Input
member.summary: Input - Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption
member.summary: Specifies the options of the Toolbar item display area when the Toolbar content overflows to available space.Applicable to `Popup` mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.None
member.summary: None - No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Show
member.summary: Show - Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Hide
member.summary: Hide - Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem
member.summary: An item object that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ChildContent
member.summary: Child Content for Toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.OnClick
member.summary: Event triggers when click the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1
member.summary: Specifies the TreeView component.
Specifies the TreeView component.
SfTreeView component.

The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with advanced functions to edit, drag and drop, select with CheckBox and more. TreeView can be populated from a data source such as an array of data's or from DataManager.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when any changes in component state occurs.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Get the RenderFragment content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `AllowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: Enables or disables to wrap the text in the TreeView node. When the `AllowTextWrap` property is set to true, the TreeView node text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `CheckedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the checked nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the TreeView component is disabled or not. When set to true, user interaction will not be occurred in TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.DropArea
member.summary: Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs in the entire page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `SelectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the expanded nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowNavigable
member.summary: If this property is set to true, then the entire TreeView node will be navigate-able instead of text element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `AllowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the selected nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Specify the HtmlAttributes for TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.TreeViewTemplates
member.summary: Specifies the custom item template of TreeView Node item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ID
member.summary: Sets id attribute for the treeview element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.UpdateAnimationProperties(Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the Animation properties.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AddNodes(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0},System.String)
member.summary: Adds the collection of TreeView nodes based on target and index position. If target node is not specified, then the nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.
member.param: A list of nodes to be added to the TreeView.
Based on target nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.BeginEdit(System.String)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `BeginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.BeginEditAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `BeginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.

member.summary: Checks all the unchecked nodes. You can also check specific nodes by passing array of unchecked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetTreeData(System.String)
member.summary: To get the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unSelecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unChecking, adding and removing node. If you pass the ID of TreeView node as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains custom attributes if you specified in data source.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
member.summary: The class provides data for the animation to Dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon before or after the text content in the Button. The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.

member.summary: Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IsToggle
member.summary: Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`. When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ID
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets content for the Dialog element including HTML support and its customizations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-positioning the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AnimationSettings
member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the dialog component. The animation effect can be applied to open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Buttons
member.summary: Configures the action `Buttons` that contains button properties with primary attributes and the click events. One or more action buttons can be configured to the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be closed on pressing the escape (ESC) key. that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's content section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If the enableResize is true, the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ResizeHandles
member.summary: Specifies the resize handles direction in the dialog component that can be resized by the end-user.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with the dialog's footer area. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with the action buttons. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with a plain text. The dialog will be displayed without the header if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates an overlay that disables interaction with the parent application and the user who should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with the parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.MinHeight
member.summary: Specifies the min-height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Position
member.summary: Specifies the value where the dialog can be positioned within the document or target. The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. `X value`: left, center, right, or offset value. `Y value`: top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon can be shown in the dialog’s title section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.VisibleChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the dialog button instances by index. Based on that, you can dynamically change the button states.
member.returns: Returns the dialog button instances by index.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.GetButtonItems
member.summary: Returns all the dialog button’s instances which are rendered in the dialog’s footer. Based on that, you can dynamically change the buttons states.
member.returns: Returns all the dialog button’s instances.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode
member.summary: To set the open modes available for the Tooltip.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Auto
member.summary: In Auto mode, the tooltip appears when you hover over the target or when the target element receives the focus. In mobile devices, the tooltip opens on tap and hold of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Hover
member.summary: In Hover mode, the tooltip appears when you hover over the target on the desktop. In mobile devices, the tooltip opens on a tap and hold of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Click
member.summary: In Click mode, the tooltip appears when you click a target element on the desktop. In mobile devices, Tooltip appears with a single tap on the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Focus
member.summary: In Focus mode, Tooltip appears when you focus on a target element in desktop. In mobile devices, Tooltip appears with a single tap on the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Custom
member.summary: In Custom mode, the tooltip will not appear on any default action. You have to bind your custom events and use either open or close public methods in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip
member.summary: The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Closed
member.summary: The event `Closed` will be fired when the Tooltip component gets closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Opened
member.summary: The event `Opened` will be fired after the Tooltip component gets opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnClose
member.summary: The event `OnClose` will be fired before the Tooltip hides from the screen. The Tooltip close can be prevented by setting the cancel argument value to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnCollision
member.summary: The event `OnCollision` will be fired for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnOpen
member.summary: The event `OnOpen` will be fired before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used to refresh the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnRender
member.summary: The event `OnRender` will be fired before the Tooltip and its contents will be added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Created
member.summary: The event `Created` will be fired after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Destroyed
member.summary: The event `Destroyed` will be fired when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when any changes in component state occurs.

member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.
member.param: Set to true for the first time component rendering; otherwise gets false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the content which has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ID
member.summary: Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Defines the content template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Animation
member.summary: It is used to customize the animation of the Tooltip while opening and closing. The animation property also allows you to set delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice. You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.CloseDelay
member.summary: To close the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Content
member.summary: To display the content of the Tooltip which can be a string element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.CssClass
member.summary: To customize the Tooltip which accepts the custom CSS class names that define specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: This property has been deprecated as we achieve this behavior by using ChildContent of render fragment type and and Content as a string value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnablePersistence
member.summary: As there are no properties required to persist in tooltip component, this property is deprecated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnableRtl
member.summary: To enable or disable the rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.WindowCollision
member.summary: It is used to set the collision target element as page viewport (window) or Tooltip element, when using the target. If this property is enabled, tooltip will perform the collision calculation between the target elements. and viewport(window) instead of Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Height
member.summary: To set the height of the Tooltip component which accepts the string values. When the Tooltip content gets overflowed due to the height value, then the scroll mode will be enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.IsSticky
member.summary: To display the Tooltip in an open state until it is closed manually.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.MouseTrail
member.summary: It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer moves over the specified target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OffsetX
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OffsetY
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y-axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OpenDelay
member.summary: To open the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OpensOn
member.summary: To determine the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content. The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Position
member.summary: To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ShowTipPointer
member.summary: To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Target
member.summary: To denote the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed. The target element is considered as the parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.TipPointerPosition
member.summary: It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End. When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Width
member.summary: To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Adds the additional html attributes to the Tooltip element.
